Paper

Paper is a WordPress Theme built using Underscore framework.

  • Responsive: You can rest easy knowing that your website will always be running smoothly across browsers.
  • Browser Compatibility: It’s important that your website performs well for everyone who visits it.
  • Complete Localization: which means you wont have to spend hours editing PHP files.

Paper Press

Hi. I'm PaperPress a starter theme based on _s, or underscores, and include a responsive layout base on Matthew Hartman's Base framework http://matthewhartman.github.io/base/. I'm a theme meant for hacking so don't use me as a Parent Theme. Instead try turning me into the next, most awesome, WordPress theme out there. That's what I'm here for. http://paperpress.agustealo.com/

  • Responsive: You can rest easy knowing that your website will always be running smoothly across browsers.
  • Browser Compatibility: It’s important that your website performs well for everyone who visits it.
  • Complete Localization: which means you wont have to spend hours editing PHP files.

briite

briite is a WordPress Theme for presenting your online portfolio. briite is part of the Kriate project... it's totally free.

Web site: www.agustealo.com

Front End Developer | Designer

I'm a seasoned digital designer and have transitioned into programing and development. I try to introduce the same creativity and functionality I acquired from my design background and apply the same discipline in my development.

When designing or developing I include the latest in what’s trending in design, technology and web standards. Ensuring Speed, Flexibility, Expandability, Compatibility, and Compliance with Css / Html, Mobile Websites, also CMS & E-Commerce Integration. Offering a wide range of powerful multi-platform mobile solutions.

-I design websites with usability and communication in mind.

My Blog

Self Marketing For Freelance Designers

Self-marketing for freelance designers is very important. Although you might undoubtedly be great at what you do, in the freelance business, skills is not enough. Competing in today's economy can be rough, it almost seems like they're 100 designers for every 1 client willing to hire.

CSS Size Properties

I was asked a question today by a friend who is learning web design. She wanted to know the difference between CSS size properties and methods, why use PX vs PT for fonts, or 100% vs EM. I would like to start by saying I’m not an expert on the matter but I will try to explain as best as I understand without a over complicated explanation.
